content.description: This is the best line at its grade in the area. A memorable route that will remain in your dreams for a long time. Start off a ledge, moving right towards a huge left-facing flake high on the route.
content.location: Down to the left of chewy in the south sport wall.

content.description: Fantastic route that was originally done with three or four bolts. Moderate climbing past the first bolt leads to a small cave. Continue on moderate terrain until the rock gets steeper and the climbing gets fun. Stay right as you near the last bolt.
content.location: Near the south end of the bluff. Left of Farewell to Boone Co. Currently a purple sling is visible at the small cave (2015).

content.description: Just left of Chewy. Interesting technical and balancy crux at second bolt leads to moderate climbing and joins with Chewy for last two bolts.
content.location: Just left of Chewy. Starts in a shallow, right facing dihedral from the tree on the ledge 10 ft off the ground.

content.description: My last FA before leaving MO.   This route follows a L angling hairline crack on very sustained hard face climbing.
content.protection: Originally done on trad gear, 2 bolts and a FP.  Now 6 bolts, FP and rack to 3"
content.location: The tallest and steepest section of the right side of the cliff.

content.description: A tough route on the wall. Pull the awkward start of Traverse of My Dreams, heading immediately up and left, then back right, through crimpy, technical terrain. Watch for loose rock. Catch the classic chossy Missouri chert band rest and prepare for the meat of the climb. Thin, demanding climbing on the bottom of the bulge leads to a series of sloping crimps and a few pockets as the wall turns slabby. The stone above the rest is absolutely stellar.
content.location: Start on Traverse of my dreams, finish direct.Â

content.description: A forgotten route between classics. Climb off a grassy ledge and into a seam and flake.
Interesting moves down low lead to moderate climbing above. Joins with Han for the last two bolts.
content.location: First route to the left of Scorpio, near the middle of the southern bluff.

content.description: Beautiful, tall limestone with a few high quality routes (as well as a few that are worth passing up) and a lot of history.
